description.narrative:
Omprogrammerade medel för att lindra konsekvenserna av covid-19 Den 16 maj 2017 inkom Kambodjas jämställdhetsministerium, Ministry of Women (MoWA), och UNDP med en gemensam ansökan om finansiering av ett jämställdhetsprogram med titel "Leading the Way Forward". Det föreslagna programmet var en fortsättning på det tidigare stödet till MoWA och UNDP (avtalspart UNDP) och det gemensamma programmet "Partnership for Gender Equality (PGE) III" (insatsnummer 51100037), till vilket Sida gett ett stöd om 8 000 000 SEK under perioden 2012-2015.
I samband med insatsens beredning under våren 2017, var avsikten att stödet skulle kanaliseras till både MoWa och UNDP med två avtalspartners. UNDP skulle hantera 50 % av stödet genom en s.k. National Implementation Modality (NIM), genom vilken MoWA skulle ansvara för genomförande under uppföljning av UNDP, och en gradvis ökning av direktfinansiering skulle ske till MoWA. I januari 2017 gav Sida stöd till MoWA i form av en teknisk expertis, vars syfte var att bistå parterna att utveckla former för det nya programmet. Ambassaden höll ett kommittémöte om insatsen den 1 juli 2017. En reviderad version av ansökan inkom ambassaden den 26 juli 2017.
I samband med det förvärrade politiska läget under hösten 2017, med Kambodjas beslut om upplösning av oppositionspartiet, har formerna för samarbetet ändrats. Sida har kommit fram till följande hållning i förhållande till statliga partners:
"Till dess att den svenska regeringen eventuellt väljer att ge Sida andra instruktioner, ingås inga nya insatsavtal inom utvecklingssamarbetet som innebär att det kanaliseras finansiella resurser direkt till staten, med undantag för stöd till utbildning och forskning."
Finansiellt stöd till, och avtal med, jämställdhetsministeriet är därmed inte längre aktuellt. Insatsen bedöms dock fortsatt vara relevant. Den 11 december 2017 inkom UNDP med projektförslaget "Project to Support the Leading the Way for Gender Equality Programme". Insatsen syftar till att stärka MoWA:s program: att stärka den offentliga sektorn genom att utforma och genomföra jämställdhetspolicys, stärka samverkan kring jämställdhet, främja en attitydförändring för ökad jämställdhet hos allmänheten och unga kambodjaner, samt främja ökat antal kvinnor i beslutsfattande positioner liksom ett stärkt kvinnligt ledarskap. I tillägg har stöd till civilsamhället och dess roll inom jämställdhetsarbetet inkluderats. Avtalspartner är UNDP.
Genom NIM-finansiering, ansvarar jämställdhetsministeriet för medelshantering och genomför insatser. I tillägg finansieras insats för särskilt utsatta grupper genomförs i samverkan med utbildnings-, civil service- och informationsministerierna. Genom programmet erhåller jämställdhetsministeriet kapacitetsstöd för att genomföra jämställdhetsinsatser.
Insatsen kommer att pågå under perioden 1 september 2017 till 31 december 2020 och uppgår till totalt ca 17,5 MSEK (2 048 629 USD), utav vilket Sida finansierar 9,5 MSEK. Resterande belopp finansieras av UNDP i form av en internationell teknisk rådgivare samt finansiering av enstaka insatser.

Reprogrammed funds to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 The programme aims to support Cambodia in effectively institutionalizing gender equality policies across government, strengthen coordination on gender equality, promote changes in attitude in favor of enhanced equality amongst citizens and young Cambodians, and promote an increased number of women in decision making positions and a strengthened feminist leadership. Besides support to the implementation of activities, MoWA will, through UNDP, receive support to strengthen its capacity to plan for, implement and follow up on gender equality interventions.

The overall goal of the programme is to contribute to "Enabled environment for gender equality, womens empowerment and feminist leaderships in Cambodia". The goal will be achieved through the following three outcomes:
1) More effective integration of gender policies across government, and more effective performance of Gender Machinery to lead gender equality mainstreaming with inclusion of disadvantaged groups of women and girls. 2) Public behavioural change in favour of gender equality is promoted among young Cambodians. 3) Increased number of and capacities of women in decision-making positions and strengthened feminist leadership.

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

title.narrative: Decision on Contribution, UNDP Gender Equality Programme 2017-2020

description.narrative:
The programme "Leading the Way for Gender Equality" has over a three year period produced important results in the areas of policy development, institutional capacity building and monitoring and evaluations systems for gender equality. It has been an important driver to strengthen Ministry of Women´s Affair (MoWA)'s role for inter-ministerial coordination and mainstreaming of gender equality and has developed a number of toolkits, manuals and analytical reports for this purpose. The programme has also successfully implemented a number of different awareness raising campaigns specifically targeting young Cambodians and MoWA's capacity to produce content attractive enough to reach out to youths on social media has been improved. Progress under the third outcome focused on increasing the number of women in decision-making positions and strengthening feminist leadership has been the most challenging. Although many of the activities under the outcome were carried out, stronger support at the highest level of government and more time is needed to achieve meaningful results for such an ambitious area. Examples of results from under the three outcomes are summarized below:
1) More effective integration of gender policies across government, and more effective performance of Gender Machinery to lead gender equality mainstreaming with inclusion of disadvantaged groups of women and girls.
- Policy Development
A final draft of the National Policy on Gender Equality was developed through wider consultations with relevant ministries, institutions, civil society organisations (CSOs), the private sector, and development partners (DPs). The National Policy is expected to be submitted to the Council of Ministers early 2022 for review and approval. The Neary Rattanak V (NRV) a Five Year Strategic Plan on Gender Equality (2019-2023) was published and disseminated in Khmer and English and is being used and referred to by MoWA´s departments and entities to develop their three-year operational work plan, 2021 annual work plan, and the monitoring and evaluation (M&E) framework/work plan. The full eight chapters of the Cambodia Gender Assessment (CGA) were finalized in early 2021 and are undergoing review and proofreading before submission to MoWAs senior management for endorsement and publication. A joint work plan between MoWA and the Secretariat of the National Committee for Sub-National Democratic Development (NCDD-S) was developed to mainstream gender into the National Programme on Decentralization and De-concentration (D&D). With technical support from MoWA, gender equality and key principles were considered, including in the draft concept note for a ten-year National Programme of Sub-National Democratic Development (2020-2030).
- Institutional Capacity Development
A comprehensive Capacity Development Framework (CDF) was developed during the programmes inception stage with a strong focus on building the capacities of MoWA and pilot ministries. 20 MoWA´s officers were trained and coached to become master trainers and specialists on gender analysis, gender mainstreaming, and advocacy, and 30 MoWA´s departmental focal points were trained to become the M&E focal points for NRV strategy implementation. There is evidence of stronger management of finances and human resources, largely due to technical support provided under the project and through the National Implementation Modality (NIM). MoWA met the audit and financial review requirements with no serious problems. 30 line ministries established Gender Mainstreaming Action Groups (GMAGs) in 2019 and 2020. With technical support from MoWA, 9 Gender Mainstreaming Action Plans (GMAPs) of the Ministry of Mines and Energy (MINE), Ministry of Economy and Finance (MEF), Ministry of Commerce (MoC), Ministry of National Defense (MoND), Ministry of Civil Service (MoCS), Council of Ministers (CoM), Ministry of Land Management, Urban Planning and Construction (MoLMUPC), Ministry of Labour and Vocational Training (MoLVT), and the Forestry Administration (FA) were developed and implemented in 2020 with sufficient budget allocated from the national budget and development partners including Asia Development Bank (ADB), Australia Department for Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT), and the World Bank (WB).
- Strengthening the National Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) System
Under the leadership of the Cambodia National Council for Women (CNCW) Secretariat, harmonized M&E tools and a system for Covention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination against Women (CEDAW) reporting was developed. The capacity of the line ministries was improved through various capacity development approaches and activities, including follow-up coaching and guiding sessions related to M&E topics. These harmonized M&E tools and systems have been updated continuously to be aligned with the key principles of the National Policy on Gender Equality. With technical support from MoWA, a national technical working group was established in 2019 to address the needs of vulnerable groups of women and girls. The overall responsibility and role of the working group is to address and promote the inclusion of vulnerable groups of women and girls within MoWAs programmes and policies for the country, including the Neary Rattanak V Strategic Plan and the National Action Plan to Prevent Violence Against Women 2019-2023 (NAPVAW).
2) Public behavioural change in favour of gender equality is promoted among young Cambodians.
- Promoting Youth Champions
The MoWA Young Professionals Network was established to empower, motivate and retain young civil servants, as well as to build a network with other youth groups to promote gender equality and young womens empowerment. The network regularly worked with four partner universities (Royal University of Law and Economics (RULE), University of Cambodia (UC), National University of Management (NUM), and Phnom Penh International University (PPIU) to organize the National Youth Debate on gender equality and to broadcast through national and private TV, as well as social media platforms. Throughout the project, 3 National Youth Debates on 9 topics related to gender equality and womens empowerment were organized. The debates reached more than 2 million viewers through TV and social media. There is evidence of a deep understanding of the linkages between the activities with youth and other results areas, such as violence against women, promoting women´s leadership, and promoting the rights of disadvantaged groups. Innovative ethnographic research using Feminist Participatory Action Research as a methodology was also conducted to better comprehend the situations and needs of women from the five groups and to identify policy and legal interventions that address discrimination against them and improve their lives. The findings of the research were used in the Cambodia Gender Assessment and informed the development of the National Gender Policy and the Neary Ratanak V. The successful establishment of the Youth Leadership Lab for Gender Equality programme resulted in the continuation of the Lab for a second season. This is part of MOWAs plans to continue to promote youth leadership and involve youth as change agents to promote gender equality. 3 MoUs were signed between MoWA and three universities Royal University of Phnom Penh (RUPP), Royal University of Agriculture (RUA), and University of Cambodia (UC), which aim to strengthen cooperation and partnerships to foster positive attitudes in promoting gender equality and increasing women´s empowerment in the universities.
- Public Awareness and Mass Media
MoWA´s Social Media Working Group was established in 2020 with 25 members from all of its departments. 7 meetings were conducted in order to develop the MoWA Social Media Master Plan and work plan. Awareness-raising campaigns and events on gender equality issues led to an increase in the number of visits and views to the MoWA Facebook page. There were 1,695,601 visits to the page by the end of the third quarter of 2021. The 16-day campaign, 16 Days of Activism against Gender-Based Violence, and International Women´s Day, were the key communications events to promote public awareness of gender equality. Articles and key messages relevant to these campaigns were developed through a competitive process that allowed the public to join and share their creative ideas to promote gender equality and the prevention and elimination of violence against women and girls. The selected articles and messages were shared and posted throughout social media channels, including through the social media pages of MoWA and development partners.
3) Increased number of and capacities of women in decision-making positions and strengthened feminist leadership.
A Technical Working Group on Women, Leadership, and Governance (TWG-WLG) was established as part of the sub-working group of the Technical Working Group on Gender (TWG-G). With technical support from MoWA, the annual work plan was developed in consultation with its members and relevant stakeholders. A report on women in leadership was developed and disseminated by the MoWA Department of Gender Equality. The report provides overall lessons learned and recommendations in promoting womens representation in the civil service and decision-making to achieve the target outlined in the Cambodian Sustainable Development Goals (CSDGs). The working group also actively contributed their input and efforts to finalize the Cambdia Gender Assessment (CGA) chapter on Women in Leadership and Governance. The group designed the data set on women´s decision-making in the public and political spheres. It also developed 5 case studies on women in politics and governance. As a joint commitment between MoWA and the Royal School of Administration (RSA), a leadership training programme for women leaders has been included in the training curriculum of the RSA and the National School of Local Administration (NASLA).
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
